text: Those who fail to plan, plan to fail.
Traditional thought suggests that a siege cannot be won without greatly superior numbers.
The patient wolf kills the careless prey.
To win a long war, a general must think about all pieces on the board, not just the one in his hand.
With your mastery over logistics, preparation, strategic planning, and long term thinking, there is no force or fort that cannot crumple in time.
[[b]]Siegecraft[[/b]] can be increased by battles, enemy casualities, and assignments.
[[b]]Siegecraft[[/b]] can be decreased by losing battles, friendly casualities, and decay.
• Increases via winning battles and amount of enemy casualities caused
The ancient tenants of the Warring States are as relevant as ever in modern warfare. Through mastery of siege, rival bastions can be knocked aside as easy as kicking sand in the road.
